markdown.markdown:
| Use the Natural Earth dataset as your primary source for a visually stunning small-scale world or continent map.


### 1.1 Load libraries and data

```{r}
#| label: load libraries and data

library(pacman)
pacman :: p_load(tidyverse, dplyr, ragg, showtext, sf)

```

### 1.2 Set theme

```{r}
#| label: set theme 

theme_30d <- function() {
  # Set base theme  =============================================
  theme_minimal() +
    # Overwrite base theme defaults ============================================
    theme(
      # Text elements ==========================================================
      plot.title = element_text(
        size = 18,
        face = "bold",
        color = "#333333",
        margin = margin(b = 10)
      ),
      plot.subtitle = element_text(
        size = 14,
        color = "#999999",
        margin = margin(b = 10)
      ),
      plot.caption = element_text(
        size = 13,
        color = "#777777",
        margin = margin(t = 15),
        hjust = 0
      ),
      axis.text = element_text(
        size = 11,
        color = "#333333"
      ),
      plot.title.position = "plot",
      plot.caption.position = "plot",

    # Remove axes & gridlines completely
      axis.text = element_blank(),
      axis.title = element_blank(),
      axis.ticks = element_blank(),
      panel.grid = element_blank(),
    )
}  #### thanks r for the rest of us 
```

## 2. DATA WRANGLING

## 3. PLOT
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
## {day}

| Use the Natural Earth dataset as your primary source for a visually stunning small-scale world or continent map.

## 1. SETUP

### 1.1 Load libraries and data

```{r}
#| label: load libraries and data

library(pacman)
pacman :: p_load(tidyverse, dplyr, ragg, showtext, sf)

```

### 1.2 Set theme

```{r}
#| label: set theme 

theme_30d <- function() {
  # Set base theme  =============================================
  theme_minimal() +
    # Overwrite base theme defaults ============================================
    theme(
      # Text elements ==========================================================
      plot.title = element_text(
        size = 18,
        face = "bold",
        color = "#333333",
        margin = margin(b = 10)
      ),
      plot.subtitle = element_text(
        size = 14,
        color = "#999999",
        margin = margin(b = 10)
      ),
      plot.caption = element_text(
        size = 13,
        color = "#777777",
        margin = margin(t = 15),
        hjust = 0
      ),
      axis.text = element_text(
        size = 11,
        color = "#333333"
      ),
      plot.title.position = "plot",
      plot.caption.position = "plot",

    # Remove axes & gridlines completely
      axis.text = element_blank(),
      axis.title = element_blank(),
      axis.ticks = element_blank(),
      panel.grid = element_blank(),
    )
}  #### thanks r for the rest of us 
```
